metadata.title: AI-Generated Test Case Improvements - Feedback Loop Analysis
metadata.methodology: Analyzed test failures, code changes, coverage gaps, and production patterns

key_findings.finding: CART-03 failed due to price mismatch ($19.99 actual vs $29.99 expected)
key_findings.root_cause: Hard-coded price assertions in tests coupled with volatile product data
key_findings.impact: Test fragility, potential revenue loss from undetected price discrepancies

key_findings.finding: Recent UI changes: Login button text changed from 'Login' to 'Submit', button ID changed from 'login-button' to 'submit-button', burger menu reordered
key_findings.impact: Existing tests may break if relying on text-based locators; need element-based assertions

key_findings.finding: Rate limiting detected in multiple test runs (CART-03, AUTH-03, CART-02)
key_findings.root_cause: System resource constraints or throttling mechanisms activated
key_findings.impact: Flaky tests, potential production performance issues during peak load

key_findings.finding: Zero mobile test coverage despite 60-70% of e-commerce traffic being mobile
key_findings.root_cause: All tests run at desktop viewport (1080x1440)
key_findings.impact: Mobile user experience issues undetected, high mobile bounce rate risk

key_findings.finding: 100% pass rate on authentication tests (AUTH-01 through AUTH-04)

code_change_patterns.recommendation: Implement dynamic price validation instead of hard-coded values
Use stable data-test attributes; avoid text-based locators
Add tests for menu order and navigation flow consistency

immediate_priority.name: Price Consistency Across User Journey
immediate_priority.business_value: Prevents revenue loss from price discrepancies
immediate_priority.description: Validates that product price remains consistent from catalog → cart → checkout → confirmation
immediate_priority.rationale: Directly addresses CART-03 failure root cause
steps: Capture price of 'Sauce Labs Backpack' from product card (dynamic extraction)
Assert cart shows same price as captured
Assert checkout overview shows same price
Assert order confirmation shows same price
Store price in variable for comparison across all steps
assertions: Price displayed is numeric and formatted as currency
Price matches across all pages (catalog, cart, checkout, confirmation)
Tax calculation is based on correct item price
immediate_priority.expected_outcome: All price displays match within $0.01 tolerance

immediate_priority.name: Login Button Element Stability
immediate_priority.business_value: Ensures login functionality works regardless of button text changes
immediate_priority.description: Validates login button can be located by stable attributes even if text changes
immediate_priority.rationale: Recent change from 'Login' to 'Submit' button text; prevents future breaks
steps: Locate submit button by data-test='submit-button' attribute
Verify button exists and is enabled
Click button using element reference (not text)
assertions: Button element found by data-test attribute
Login succeeds regardless of button text content
immediate_priority.expected_outcome: Login works with element-based locator, not text-based
edge_cases: Button text changes to 'Submit', 'Sign In', 'Enter', or other variations
Button has additional CSS classes added

immediate_priority.name: Burger Menu Navigation Order Verification
immediate_priority.business_value: Ensures navigation menu consistency after restructuring
immediate_priority.description: Validates burger menu items appear in correct order after recent reordering
steps: Assert fourth item is 'Reset App State'
Click each menu item and verify navigation
assertions: 'Logout' logs user out and redirects to login
'Reset App State' clears cart without navigation
immediate_priority.expected_outcome: Menu items appear in documented order and function correctly

immediate_priority.name: Page Load Time Baseline for Critical User Flows
immediate_priority.business_value: Establishes performance monitoring and early warning system
immediate_priority.description: Measures and validates page load times across all critical pages
immediate_priority.rationale: Rate limiting detected indicates performance issues; need baseline metrics
steps: Measure: Navigate to homepage - record load time
Measure: Login - record time to Products page
Measure: Product details page load time
Measure: Add to cart - record cart update time
immediate_priority.expected_outcome: All pages meet performance budgets; establish baseline for monitoring
immediate_priority.monitoring: Track trend over time; alert if any page exceeds budget by 50%

mobile_coverage.name: Mobile Login Flow
mobile_coverage.business_value: Validates login works on mobile devices (60-70% of traffic)
mobile_coverage.description: Complete login flow on mobile viewport with touch interactions
steps: Verify Products page renders correctly on mobile
assertions: All form elements visible without horizontal scroll
mobile_coverage.expected_outcome: Login succeeds on all mobile viewports with good UX

mobile_coverage.name: Mobile Shopping Cart & Checkout
mobile_coverage.business_value: Validates complete purchase flow on mobile
mobile_coverage.description: End-to-end mobile purchase: browse → add to cart → checkout → confirm
assertions: Product images load and scale correctly
Mobile keyboard doesn't obscure input fields
Cart icon and badge visible on mobile header
mobile_coverage.expected_outcome: Complete purchase flow works seamlessly on mobile

mobile_coverage.name: Mobile Burger Menu Navigation
mobile_coverage.description: Test mobile burger menu interactions and navigation
steps: Verify menu items visible and touch-friendly
mobile_coverage.expected_outcome: All menu functions work properly on mobile devices

edge_cases.name: Cart Operations Under Rate Limiting
edge_cases.business_value: Ensures cart functionality degrades gracefully under load
edge_cases.description: Tests cart behavior when system experiences rate limiting
edge_cases.rationale: Rate limiting detected in production; need to ensure graceful degradation
steps: Verify cart updates correctly after rate limit period
assertions: User receives clear feedback if rate limited
Cart state remains consistent (no phantom items)
No data loss during rate limiting
Operations queue and execute after limit passes
User can still complete checkout after rate limit clears
edge_cases.expected_outcome: System handles rate limiting gracefully with clear user feedback
edge_scenarios: Concurrent cart modifications from multiple tabs

edge_cases.name: Price Change Mid-Session Handling
edge_cases.business_value: Prevents checkout with stale pricing data
edge_cases.description: Tests behavior when product price changes while item is in cart
edge_cases.rationale: Frequent price changes in production; need to handle mid-session updates
edge_cases.setup: Requires ability to change product price during test execution
steps: Add product to cart at price $X
Simulate price change to $Y (via API or database)
Verify user is notified of price change
Verify order confirmation shows correct price
assertions: User receives notification of price change
Cart automatically updates to new price OR user must re-add item
edge_cases.expected_outcome: System prevents checkout with outdated pricing
edge_cases.business_rule: Customer should pay current price at checkout time, not cart-add time

edge_cases.name: Session Timeout During Checkout
edge_cases.business_value: Prevents lost sales from session timeouts
edge_cases.description: Tests behavior when session expires during checkout process
edge_cases.rationale: No current testing of session timeout scenarios (KAN-38 backlog item)
steps: Login and add items to cart
Wait for session timeout (simulate or trigger)
assertions: User receives clear session timeout message
User is redirected to login page
User can complete checkout after re-authentication
edge_cases.expected_outcome: Session timeout doesn't cause cart loss; user can recover
alternative_scenarios: Session timeout on order review page
Session timeout at moment of order submission

edge_cases.name: Checkout Form Input Validation Edge Cases
edge_cases.business_value: Prevents data corruption and security vulnerabilities
edge_cases.description: Tests checkout form with boundary values and special characters
edge_cases.rationale: No current edge case testing for checkout forms

test_cases.expected: Truncate or reject with clear error
Sanitize or reject; no XSS vulnerability
All formats accepted or appropriate validation

test_cases.input: Submit with blank first name, last name, zip
test_cases.expected: Clear validation errors; form doesn't submit

assertions: International formats supported or clearly rejected
No system errors from invalid input
edge_cases.expected_outcome: All invalid inputs handled gracefully with user-friendly errors

edge_cases.name: Concurrent Session Shopping Cart Sync
edge_cases.description: Tests cart synchronization when same user shops from multiple devices
edge_cases.rationale: No current testing of concurrent cart operations
edge_cases.setup: Requires two browser sessions or incognito windows
steps: Login to same account in Browser A
Login to same account in Browser B
Add 'Product 1' to cart in Browser A
Add 'Product 2' to cart in Browser B
Proceed to checkout in Browser B
assertions: Cart updates visible in both sessions (or clear messaging about single-device cart)
No race conditions causing duplicate items
No items lost due to concurrent updates
Last-write-wins OR conflict resolution strategy is clear
Checkout uses most recent cart state
edge_cases.expected_outcome: Cart state consistent across sessions OR clear single-device policy
edge_cases.business_decision_needed: Should cart sync across devices or be device-specific?

data_driven_tests.name: All Products Add-to-Cart Validation
data_driven_tests.business_value: Ensures all products can be purchased
data_driven_tests.description: Iterates through all products and validates add-to-cart functionality
data_driven_tests.rationale: Current tests only check specific products; need comprehensive coverage
assertions: All 6 products have functional 'Add to cart' buttons
Cart badge accurately reflects item count
Product details (name, price) correct in cart
Remove from cart works for all products
data_driven_tests.expected_outcome: 100% of products can be added and removed from cart successfully

data_driven_tests.name: All User Types Login Validation
data_driven_tests.business_value: Validates login for all user personas
data_driven_tests.description: Tests login functionality for all documented user types
data_driven_tests.rationale: Current tests primarily use standard_user; need coverage for all user types
assertions: problem_user: Login succeeds but subsequent actions may have issues
performance_glitch_user: Login succeeds after noticeable delay
visual_user: Login succeeds but UI may have visual differences
data_driven_tests.expected_outcome: Each user type behaves according to specification

accessibility_tests.name: Keyboard Navigation - Full User Journey
accessibility_tests.business_value: Ensures compliance with WCAG 2.1 AA; avoids legal risk
accessibility_tests.description: Complete user journey using only keyboard (no mouse)
accessibility_tests.rationale: Zero current accessibility testing; WCAG compliance required
steps: Press Enter on 'Add to cart' button
assertions: All interactive elements reachable via Tab
Tab order logical (top to bottom, left to right)
accessibility_tests.expected_outcome: Complete purchase flow possible using keyboard only

accessibility_tests.name: Screen Reader Compatibility
accessibility_tests.business_value: Enables visually impaired users to shop; WCAG compliance
accessibility_tests.description: Tests screen reader announcements for all critical actions
checks: All images have meaningful alt text
Error messages announced to screen reader
Page landmarks defined (header, nav, main, footer)
assertions: Product images have descriptive alt text
Navigation structure logical for screen reader users
accessibility_tests.expected_outcome: All critical information accessible via screen reader
accessibility_tests.wcag_criteria: 1.1.1 Non-text Content, 1.3.1 Info and Relationships, 4.1.3 Status Messages

security_tests.name: Authentication Bypass Attempts
assertions: Session tokens cannot be easily manipulated
security_tests.expected_outcome: All bypass attempts fail; system remains secure

dynamic_pricing_strategy.current_problem: Hard-coded price assertions fail when product prices change
dynamic_pricing_strategy.recommendation: Implement dynamic price extraction and validation

implementation.step_1: Capture price from product page: priceVar = extractPrice(productPage)
implementation.step_2: Validate price format: assert priceVar matches /^\$[0-9]+\.[0-9]{2}$/
implementation.step_3: Use captured price in assertions: assert cartPrice === priceVar
implementation.step_4: Track price changes: log price to database for historical analysis

dynamic_pricing_strategy.alternative: Maintain price reference file updated with each deployment

test_data_management.current_state: Test data embedded in test scripts
test_data_management.recommendation: Centralize test data in external files
benefits: Single source of truth for test data
Easier updates when business data changes

structure.users.json: All test user credentials and properties
structure.products.json: Product catalog with prices, names, descriptions
structure.api_endpoints.json: All API URLs for different environments

activities: Review test failures from past week
Review code commits for test impacts
Identify coverage gaps from new features
Generate AI recommendations for new tests
Prioritize and implement top 3 test improvements
Update test data based on production changes
success_metrics: Test coverage increase: Target 80% critical path coverage
Failure rate decrease: Target < 1% failure rate
Mean time to detect (MTTD): Target < 30 minutes
Mean time to repair (MTTR): Target < 2 hours

conclusion.summary: AI analysis identified 23 high-value test cases addressing critical gaps in pricing, mobile, performance, edge cases, and accessibility. Implementation prioritized by business risk and effort.
critical_actions: Add mobile coverage this week (MOBILE-01, MOBILE-02)
expected_outcomes: Improve mobile user experience (60-70% of traffic)
Detect performance issues before users affected
Reduce test maintenance from UI changes
